name: Checking types in the first and last subarray
instruction:
Write a function `firstAndLast` that takes an array of arrays.

The function should return `true` if all elements of the first and last subarrays have the same data type.
Otherwise, the function should return `false`.

There will either be more than two subarrays or the outer array will be empty.

The first and last subarrays will always contain at least one element.

If the array is empty, the function should return the string 'Array is empty'.


Examples of function calls:
```javascript
firstAndLast([ [1, 2], ['555'], [true], [5, 6] ]);          // true
firstAndLast([ ['a', 'b', 'c'], [true], [true] ]);          // false
firstAndLast([ ['undefined', 'Hello'], ['world', '123'] ]); // true
firstAndLast([ [5 > 3, false], [], ['test'], [5, 3] ]);     // false
firstAndLast([ ]);                                          // 'Array is empty'
```
